Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as 7c8c4058e265f784679b9144ff33b89f50f1bf59 by Ed Tanous

You need to check for errors here.  If dateTime doesn't have a + in it, this will throw an exception.  I wonder if we'd be better off adjusting dateTimeNow to a version that returns both the date and the offset separately.

Ok, I will add the error check here.
And I feel, we can't go with the newer version of dateTimeNow for getting date and the offset separately,
As the dateTimeNow() is being used in different URI's like EventService, TaskService, and those URI's doesn't supports for "DateTimeLocalOffset" property.
This property only supported for Managers and LogServices URI's.
So I feel better to have this little change, rather than changing the function and all other related files.

> Ok, I will add the error check here.
> And I feel, we can't go with the newer version of dateTimeNow for getting date and the offset separately,
> As the dateTimeNow() is being used in different URI's like EventService, TaskService, and those URI's doesn't supports for "DateTimeLocalOffset" property.

It's only used in a few places, and the code is relatively straightforward to provide the old mechanism (just another method that concatenates the strings for you).

> This property only supported for Managers and LogServices URI's.
> So I feel better to have this little change, rather than changing the function and all other related files.

Not sure I agree there.  This pushes "how to determine timezone" code into a file explicitly about redfish.  Considering that this isn't the last time we'll likely need to parse timezone, I think breaking this out into its own method is warranted.
Please check your range before calling substr.  If size() returns 0, this will wrap around and throw an exception.
Done, Updated the new patch set.
This still appears to be a magic number.  Worst case, give this a descriptive name.
There is other LogServices. Who should add this for them?
There is other LogServices in here like Dump. Is it on the authors who care about those to add this ?
title has to be 50 or less then 50 char?
suggestion: getDateTimeAndOffset unable to think of good name.
how this commit get build with this change?
I guess the commit 729f55fe555e07821626aba322f42ca783652928, resolves your question.
